name: Planet VPN - Free VPN Proxy and ad blocker
summary: VPN extension with 1M+ users that enumerates and forcibly disables competing proxy extensions via chrome.management.setEnabled(). Uses Telegraph API (Telegram publishing platform) as dead-drop for AES-encrypted backend domain resolution, a C2-resilience technique allowing the operator to change API servers at any time without extension updates. Backend domain refreshed every 5 minutes.

vulnerabilities.title: Competing Extension Enumeration and Disabling
vulnerabilities.description: Popup script calls chrome.management.getAll() to find extensions with proxy permission, then chrome.management.setEnabled(id, false) to disable them on every popup open.

vulnerabilities.title: Telegraph-Based C2 Domain Resolution
vulnerabilities.description: Fetches AES-encrypted payload from api.telegra.ph, decrypts with hardcoded key to obtain actual backend API domain. Allows operator to silently redirect all extension traffic to new servers.

flags.description: Enumerates all proxy extensions and forcibly disables them via chrome.management.setEnabled()
AES-encrypted dead-drop on Telegram's Telegraph platform resolves actual API backend domain, refreshed every 5 minutes
